title-group.article-title: Divisional Beta Estimation under the Old and New Tax Laws

abstract.p: This study applies a general beta expression to divisional cost of capital estimation. The effects of personal taxes and bankruptcy costs, under both the old and the new income tax codes are explicitly incorporated. Our analysis indicates that previous attempts to estimate the divisional cost of capital produce a bias under both the old and the new tax codes. We also find that the expression for beta implied by Miller's model may be a reasonable estimate under the old tax code but an underestimate under the new tax code. Our results imply that in estimating the divisional cost of capital, personal taxes and bankruptcy costs should be incorporated in conjunction with a sensitivity analysis.
